result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory S Spicer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay a fine of $2,000.00.
Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, and fines. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
Defendant to enter into a payment plan.
Court costs, fees, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/wages.
Court set restitution at ZERO.
with credit for 20 days time served.
No driving without a valid license.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory S Spicer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Court vacated the jury trial date of 1/13/16. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
WCS Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Gregory S Spicer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant recently had surgery and defense counsel requested an adjournment to allow the defendant additional time to heal. State does not object. Court ordered final pretrial and jury trial dates be set. Defense counsel advised the Court this matter will resolve short of trial. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
WCS Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
/from defense counsel to the court, filed.

Defendant Gregory S Spicer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant undergoing recovery from surgery; defense counsel requested another plea and sentencing date.  State did not object. Court granted defense request. Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Honorable Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 in the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and set the matter for plea and sentencing before Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Gregory S Spicer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Letter from defendant's medical provider filed with the court; defense counsel requested a plea date in July.  Court granted defense request, ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and adjourned matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS report received and filed.
WCS report received and filed.

Defendant Gregory S Spicer in court with attorney Thomas Grieve for Amy C Scholz.  Ron Dague for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
